title: Ticket #2221: condor_ssh_to_job fails if /bin/sh is not bash on remote machine
description:
(Dan, Greg said to assign this to you)

When /bin/sh does not link to /bin/bash, condor_ssh_to_job does not work. This is reproducible in NMI using x86_64_deb_6.0-updated. On Debian 6 /bin/sh points at /bin/dash (note the 'd'). Here is the error message the client receives: 

tmp$ condor_ssh_to_job 2274741.0
slot2@nmi-v030.batlab.cs.wisc.edu: condor_ssh_to_job_sshd_setup failed: /usr/local/condor/libexec/condor_ssh_to_job_sshd_setup: 25: Syntax error: Bad fd number
I logged into the machine, switched /bin/sh to point to bash (instead of dash) and then condor_ssh_to_job works correctly.

To reproduce this, submit this job to NMI and then try to connect to it using condor_ssh_to_job: 

Universe   = vanilla
Executable = /bin/sleep
Arguments  = 500
Log        = simple.log
Output     = simple.out
Error      = simple.error
should_transfer_files   = YES
when_to_transfer_output = ON_EXIT
Requirements = ( nmi_platform == "x86_64_deb_6.0-updated" && Arch != "" && OpSys != "" && Memory >= 0 ) && ( TARGET.HasFileTransfer )
Queue
